item.title: Working with Physical Constants and Units
item.description: A lot of the expressions that describe chemical phenomena involve physical constants, such as the speed of light, , Avogardo’s constant, , Planck’s constant, , and the Boltzmann constant, . When working with algebraic expressions, it is also important to keep track of the relevant units. Different experiments may conventionally report data in non-S.I. units and these units must be converted for comparing data or calculating chemical properties.
